name: John's Local Challenges
description: These challenges were all made locally by the Cyber Team.

challenges.name: Warmup (misc)
challenges.prompt: It's everyone's favorite!

challenges.name: Irregular Expressions (web)
challenges.prompt: Check out our new regular expressions testbed! Now you can test your regex online at http://10.6.1.7:5555

challenges.name: Linux Kiosk (misc)
challenges.prompt:
This public computer kiosk is weird! It just offers the man page for less?

Connect to it here: ssh user@10.6.1.7 -p 1888

Username is user and password is userpass

challenges.name: 1-800-RSA-TODAY (crypto)
challenges.prompt: My phone bill is through the roof! I called Bob, but Eve found my public key!

challenges.name: Buff the Barque (pwn)
challenges.prompt:
We all hate it, but we all have to do it.

Board the barque with nc 10.6.1.7 9999. Download the barque here.

challenges.name: LSB (stego)
challenges.prompt: Ah, bonjour mon bon ami! Bienvenue a la capture du drapeau! J'ai entendu dire que vous etiez fan de la steganographie! Avez-vous deja entendu parler d'un outil appele zsteg?

challenges.name: Count Dracula (pwn)
challenges.prompt:
I like to count! Count, count, count!

Count with me at nc 10.6.1.7 7777

challenges.name: TackStack (pwn)
challenges.prompt:
Have you ever played Jenga? Tack Stack is like that game, but with tacks!

nc 10.6.1.7 3456

challenges.name: Dairy Products (web)
challenges.prompt:
There is a new advertising campaign on the classic dairy company's website. You need to steal their latest product.

http://10.6.1.7:5777/

challenges.name: Recipes™ (web)
challenges.prompt: It's online social network, but for bakers and hackers alike! Add your recipe online at http://10.6.1.7/recipes/

challenges.name: QUACK (misc)
challenges.prompt: We found this binary on a USB drive someone left lying around. There was a note attached, that read: "you're the one."

challenges.name: WhitePages (stego)
challenges.prompt: I stopped using YellowPages and moved onto WhitePages... but the book they gave me is all blank!

challenges.name: 2048 (misc)
challenges.prompt: cGx6aGVscG1l

challenges.name: Quick Run (misc)
challenges.prompt: You gotta go fast!

challenges.name: John's Password Pickler (re/pwn)
challenges.prompt:
Check out this new tool I found, it's called "John's Password Pickler!" The author thinks he can keep passwords secure. Prove him wrong by trying to steal his!

You can download the source here, but you can interact with the program remotely at
nc 10.6.1.7 1347

Note: the flag format USCGA{the_password}

challenges.name: Loopback (network)
challenges.prompt: Hello? Hello? Oh hello! Oh hello!

challenges.name: Obfuscabyss (misc)
challenges.prompt: I dropped my flag... and now it's locked away in all these strange obfuscations!

challenges.name: seed sPRiNG (pwn/crypto)
challenges.prompt:
The most revolutionary game is finally available: SEED sPRiNG is open right now!

Connect here: nc 10.6.1.7 1846

challenges.name: CALC-UL8R (misc)
challenges.prompt:
Texas Instruments latest new product: you!

Connect here: nc 10.6.1.7 6995

challenges.name: Chasm (misc)
challenges.prompt:
The Internet's new echo server. Break it.

Connect here: nc 10.6.1.7 7312

challenges.name: The Czar (misc/crypto)
challenges.prompt:
A classic... but with some twists! 

\xf1\xf1\xe9\xdf\xed\xcb\xe1\xd2\xfc\xf2\xf5\x02\xfd\xcd\xd0\x0f\x01\xf1\xd4\x06\xf4\xf2\xf1\x16\xf4\xf3\xe5\x02\xfc\xcd\xd0\x08\x00\xcc\xd4\x05\xf4\xf3\xe9\x08\xe9\x06\xed\xd4

challenges.name: Old Monitor (crypto)
challenges.prompt: I have this old CRT monitor that I use for my desktop computer. It crashed on me and spit out all these weird numbers...

challenges.name: Disco Dancer (misc)
challenges.prompt: I'm feeling so antsy, it's time for Dance Dance Revolution!

challenges.name: Hot Dog (crypto)
challenges.prompt: This isn't a problem with the grill.

challenges.name: Magician (web)
challenges.prompt: Show me a hat trick. http://10.6.1.7:1338

challenges.name: Pyg-Pen (pwn/misc)
challenges.prompt: Oh no! We are locked in a pyg-pen! Help us break out. nc 10.6.1.7 3987

challenges.name: 2xPAD (crypto)
challenges.prompt: The latest and greatest encryption scheme, "two-time pad" is twice as secure as one time pads. Check it out:

challenges.name: Sequelitis (web)
challenges.prompt: Sequelitis has moved to a new database for keeping track of their customers. Break in. http://10.6.1.7:555

challenges.name: Eyeless (web)
challenges.prompt:
My roommate just made this cool site. I wonder how secure it is...

http://10.6.1.7:2297

challenges.name: Meme Factory (web)
challenges.prompt:
I don't always make CTF challenges... but when I do, they're full of memes. http://10.6.1.7:5000/

Source code is called: memeserver.py

challenges.name: pdfmax (misc/pwn)
challenges.prompt: pdfmax version 1.0! The new online cloud interpreter. All a student could ever need! nc 10.6.1.7 5895

challenges.name: shattered (misc)
challenges.prompt:
Remember Bsides? If only we knew about tcpflow...

Wrap the flag in the typical "USCGA{}" format.
